cards.name: Auratouched Mage
cards.text: When Auratouched Mage enters the battlefield, search your library for an Aura card that could enchant it. If Auratouched Mage is still on the battlefield, put that Aura card onto the battlefield attached to it. Otherwise, reveal the Aura card and put it into your hand. Then shuffle.

cards.name: Bathe in Light
cards.text: Radiance - Choose a color. Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Truth shines even in darkness. Those who march on the side of truth walk always in righteous light."

cards.name: Benevolent Ancestor
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Although the door is flimsy and the lock pathetically small, Josuri's family never fears the night outside.

cards.name: Blazing Archon
cards.text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you.
cards.flavor:
"Through the haze of battle I saw the glint of sun on golden mane, the sheen of glory clad in mail, and I dropped my sword and wept at the idiocy of war."
-Dravin, Gruul deserter

cards.name: Boros Fury-Shield
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking or blocking creature this turn. If {R} was spent to cast this spell, Boros Fury-Shield deals damage to that creature's controller equal to the creature's power.

cards.name: Caregiver
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: "The guilds each believe its way is right, but their ways only bring blood to Ravnica's streets and tears to Ravnica's families."

cards.name: Chant of Vitu-Ghazi
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

foreignPrintings.name: ヴィトゥ＝ガジーの詠唱

cards.name: Concerted Effort
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, creatures you control gain flying until end of turn if a creature you control has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, landwalk, protection, trample, and vigilance.

cards.name: Conclave Equenaut
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Equenauts are the seeds of the Conclave, scattered on the four winds, searching for new places to take root.

cards.name: Conclave Phalanx
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
When Conclave Phalanx enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.

cards.name: Conclave's Blessing
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 for each other creature you control.

cards.name: Courier Hawk
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: The Orzhov started using hawks as messengers in order to bypass the many toll roads and bridges that dot Ravnica. Soon the service became one of their most profitable businesses.

cards.name: Devouring Light
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Exile target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Into the light the good are welcomed, and with the light the evil are banished.

cards.name: Divebomber Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Divebomber Griffin: It deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Justice flies swiftly on angry wings.

cards.name: Dromad Purebred
cards.text: Whenever Dromad Purebred is dealt damage, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen much from the back of my dromad, most of it terribly wrong. The more I see, the more I am convinced of the rightness of my path."
-Heruj, Selesnya initiate

foreignPrintings.name: ドローマッドの純血種

cards.name: Faith's Fetters
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
When Faith's Fetters enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
Enchanted permanent can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

cards.name: Festival of the Guildpact
cards.text:
Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Everyone knows that violence at the Festival brings the worst of luck, so for at least one day a year arms are laid down in favor of brimming goblets.

cards.name: Flickerform
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{2}{W}{W}: Exile enchanted creature and all Auras attached to it. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If you do, return the other cards exiled this way to the battlefield under their owners' control attached to that creature.

cards.name: Gate Hound
cards.text: Creatures you control have vigilance as long as Gate Hound is enchanted.
cards.flavor:
"Ditri, I leave this checkpoint in your capable teeth."
-Kitov, nightguard patrol

cards.name: Ghosts of the Innocent
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals half that damage, rounded down, to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor:
"Ma said we should offer up blini-cakes and salt to the good ones, but I get that chill up my spine and just shut the door."
-Otak, Tin Street shopkeep

cards.name: Hour of Reckoning
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy all nontoken creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Ravnica, like a hedge, must be pruned, leaving only leaves of verdant uniformity."
-Niszka, Selesnya evangel

cards.name: Hunted Lammasu
cards.text:
Flying
When Hunted Lammasu enters the battlefield, target opponent creates a 4/4 black Horror creature token.
cards.flavor: The lammasu ruled the velds before the city grew. Now they roam Ravnica's skies, but their ancient enemies have not forgotten them.

foreignPrintings.name: 狩り立てられたラマスー

cards.name: Leave No Trace
cards.text: Radiance - Destroy target enchantment and each other enchantment that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor: The magic of the Boros patrols the streets even when their soldiers do not.

cards.name: Light of Sanction
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control by sources you control.
cards.flavor: The Legion looks after its own.

cards.name: Loxodon Gatekeeper
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: The gatekeepers are so fastidious that even the winds must wait to pass.

cards.name: Nightguard Patrol
cards.text: First strike, vigilance
cards.flavor: "The Wojek defend the laws. We defend the people."

cards.name: Oathsworn Giant
cards.text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +0/+2 and have vigilance.
cards.flavor: The town stands on his ancestors' former burial grounds. Even with the graves long gone, he continues his determined vigil.

cards.name: Sandsower
cards.text: Tap three untapped creatures you control: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: It drifts through the streets as a breeze of collective sighs, wilting the bustle with dreams and heavy eyelids.

cards.name: Screeching Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Target creature can't block Screeching Griffin this turn.
cards.flavor: They were master fishers, but their seas are now the streets and their catch, the goblins that run pell-mell from the screeching in the sky.

foreignPrintings.name: 金切り声のグリフィン

cards.name: Seed Spark
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If {G} was spent to cast this spell, create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
cards.flavor:
"If you ask me, those root-lovers value mindless dogma over progress."
-Trivaz, Izzet mage

cards.name: Suppression Field
cards.text: Activated abilities cost {2} more to activate unless they're mana abilities.
cards.flavor: The most feared of Azorius punishments is to be freed-sent back out into the world, stripped of all magical defenses.

cards.name: Three Dreams
cards.text: Search your library for up to three Aura cards with different names, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor:
"Choose one to heal, one to harm, and one to grant you the prudence to use them."
-Miotri, auratouched mage

cards.name: Twilight Drover
cards.text:
Whenever a creature token leaves the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Twilight Drover.
{2}{W}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Twilight Drover: Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

cards.name: Veteran Armorer
cards.text: Other creatures you control get +0/+1.
cards.flavor: "Give me a sword and I'll kill a few enemies. But give me a hammer and a fiery forge, and I'll turn the tide of battle."

cards.name: Votary of the Conclave
cards.text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Votary of the Conclave.
cards.flavor: An ageless order, the votaries receive the gift of rejuvenation from the temple gardens they guard.

cards.name: Wojek Apothecary
cards.text: Radiance - {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it this turn.
cards.flavor: "A few arrows aren't enough to pierce your faith, soldier. You'll be back on the battlefield by sun's dawn."

cards.name: Wojek Siren
cards.text: Radiance - Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It is the call to arms, the call to fury, the call to blood.

cards.name: Belltower Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a source deals damage to Belltower Sphinx, that source's controller mills that many cards.

cards.name: Cerulean Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Cerulean Sphinx's owner shuffles it into their library.
cards.flavor:
"About the sphinx, I have mixed feelings. Their wisdom I crave, but their secrecy I can't tolerate."
-Szadek

cards.name: Compulsive Research
cards.text: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless they discard a land card.
cards.flavor: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"

cards.name: Convolute
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.
cards.flavor: The words came to the sorcerer's lips but refused to budge any further.

cards.name: Copy Enchantment
cards.text: You may have Copy Enchantment enter the battlefield as a copy of any enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Simic mages create redundant backups of their experiments to reduce the consequences of catastrophe.

cards.name: Dizzy Spell
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Drake Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Drake Familiar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an enchantment to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Falconry? A fine sport I suppose, if you're attracted to the frailty of birds."
-Trivaz, Izzet mage

cards.name: Dream Leash
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
You can't choose an untapped permanent as this spell's target as you cast it.
You control enchanted permanent.
cards.flavor: The tendrils of sorcery find easy purchase on the soft underbelly of dreams.

cards.name: Drift of Phantasms
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Ethereal Usher
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Eye of the Storm
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery card, exile it. Then that player copies each instant or sorcery card exiled with Eye of the Storm. For each copy, the player may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Flight of Fancy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Flight of Fancy enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.flavor: The view from above is an inspiration to the newly winged.

cards.name: Flow of Ideas
cards.text: Draw a card for each Island you control.
cards.flavor:
"A system to direct the flow of Ravnica's entire water supply? Thinking a bit small, aren't we?"
-Trivaz, Izzet mage

cards.name: Followed Footsteps
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: Æther can turn a footprint into a blueprint.

cards.name: Grayscaled Gharial
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: Each tooth carries enough bacteria to kill a person in a day or two. But then, gharials do have 138 teeth.

cards.name: Grozoth
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Grozoth enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of cards that have mana value 9, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.
{4}: Grozoth loses defender until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Halcyon Glaze
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Halcyon Glaze becomes a 4/4 Illusion creature with flying in addition to its other types until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Earth to æther, window to wonder, stillness to the sky."
-Glazing incantation

cards.name: Hunted Phantasm
cards.text:
Hunted Phantasm can't be blocked.
When Hunted Phantasm enters the battlefield, target opponent creates five 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

cards.name: Induce Paranoia
cards.text: Counter target spell. If {B} was spent to cast this spell, that spell's controller mills X cards, where X is the spell's mana value.

cards.name: Lore Broker
cards.text: {T}: Each player draws a card, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: Lies are sold as often as truths-and used just as effectively.

cards.name: Mark of Eviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, return enchanted creature and all Auras attached to that creature to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Tharashk the Bold suddenly wasn't himself. Or anyone else, for that matter.

cards.name: Mnemonic Nexus
cards.text: Each player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor: True enlightenment comes not with a new thought, but with understanding of all the old ones.

cards.name: Muddle the Mixture
cards.text:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Peel from Reality
cards.text: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: When House Dimir's secrets are in danger of exposure, the guild takes drastic measures to cover its tracks.

cards.name: Quickchange
cards.text:
Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Most Ravnicans lead lives of desperate survival. Those who thrive are malleable enough to change with the ever-shifting politics of the guilds.

cards.name: Remand
cards.text:
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it into its owner's hand instead of into that player's graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Well, at least all of that arm-waving and arcane babbling you did was impressive."

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: The irritable drakes are solitary nesters. Even brooding females barely contain the urge to attack their own young.

cards.name: Spawnbroker
cards.text: When Spawnbroker enters the battlefield, you may exchange control of target creature you control and target creature with power less than or equal to that creature's power an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "The trick isn't setting up the bad trade. It's making each side think it got the better deal."

cards.name: Stasis Cell
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.

cards.name: Surveilling Sprite
cards.text:
Flying
When Surveilling Sprite dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Their natural curiosity, combined with a knack for trespassing, makes sprites excellent spies.

cards.name: Tattered Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Tattered Drake.
cards.flavor:
"Drakes embody the worst of Ravnica: great potential, twisted by selfishness and greed."
-Razia

cards.name: Telling Time
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

cards.name: Terraformer
cards.text: {1}: Choose a basic land type. Each land you control becomes that type until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "This feels a little more like home."

cards.name: Tidewater Minion
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Tidewater Minion loses defender until end of turn.
{T}: Untap target permanent.

cards.name: Tunnel Vision
cards.text: Choose a card name. Target player reveals cards from the top of their library until a card with that name is revealed. If it is, that player puts the rest of the revealed cards into their graveyard and puts the card with the chosen name on top of their library. Otherwise, the player shuffles.

cards.name: Vedalken Dismisser
cards.text: When Vedalken Dismisser enters the battlefield, put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"I crept up on him, quiet as a guttermouse. And then suddenly I found myself facedown in a latrine pit behind Tin Street Market."
-Sirislav, Dimir spy

foreignPrintings.name: ヴィダルケンの放逐者

cards.name: Vedalken Entrancer
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Target player mills two cards.
cards.flavor: Their denial reaches far into your future.

foreignPrintings.name: ヴィダルケンの幻惑者

cards.name: Wizened Snitches
cards.text:
Flying
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
cards.flavor:
"Be careful what information you ask them to find, for it will likely be the subject of tale time at the alehouse."
-Sirislav, Dimir spy

cards.name: Zephyr Spirit
cards.text: When Zephyr Spirit blocks, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: A spiteful force exists on Ravnica that binds these ghosts to the land of the living but forbids them to touch it.

cards.name: Blood Funnel
cards.text:
Noncreature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, counter that spell unless you sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Brainspoil
cards.text:
Destroy target creature that isn't enchanted. It can't be regenerated.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Carrion Howler
cards.text: Pay 1 life: Carrion Howler gets +2/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They chase tirelessly after the bone-carts that speed along the streets of the Plague Quarter.

cards.name: Clinging Darkness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-1.
cards.flavor: There's an experience worse than blindness-it's the certainty that your vision is perfect and the horror that there's no world around you to see.

cards.name: Dark Confidant
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its mana value.
cards.flavor: Greatness, at any cost.

cards.name: Darkblast
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, you may mill three cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Dimir House Guard
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Dimir House Guard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Dimir Machinations
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library. Exile any number of those cards, then put the rest back in any order.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Disembowel
cards.text: Destroy target creature with mana value X.
cards.flavor:
"We thought we found the victim's clothes lumped in the street. As it turned out, it was the victim, insides sucked out-just a sack of skin and robes."
-Agrus Kos

cards.name: Empty the Catacombs
cards.text: Each player returns all creature cards from their graveyard to their hand.
cards.flavor: When the dead are laid to rest in Ravnica, it's usually just a nap.

cards.name: Golgari Thug
cards.text:
When Golgari Thug dies, put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, you may mill four cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Helldozer
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, untap Helldozer.
cards.flavor: Sometimes you go to hell, and sometimes hell comes to you.

cards.name: Hex
cards.text: Destroy six target creatures.
cards.flavor: When killing five just isn't enough.

cards.name: Hunted Horror
cards.text:
Trample
When Hunted Horror enters the battlefield, target opponent creates two 3/3 green Centaur creature tokens with protection from black.

cards.name: Infectious Host
cards.text: When Infectious Host dies, target player loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Lost man, dead man, knocking on the door. Cankerman, soreman, knock no more."
-Ravnican children's rhyme

cards.name: Keening Banshee
cards.text:
Flying
When Keening Banshee enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Her cold wail echoes in the alleys and under-eaves, finding the unfortunate and turning their blood to ice.

cards.name: Last Gasp
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Allow me a moment to catch your breath."

cards.name: Mausoleum Turnkey
cards.text: When Mausoleum Turnkey enters the battlefield, return target creature card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: When he reaches for his key ring, you should be running for the exit.

cards.name: Moonlight Bargain
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. For each card, put that card into your graveyard unless you pay 2 life. Then put the rest into your hand.
cards.flavor: At every fifth full moon, the Moon Market convenes to peddle Ravnica's most forbidden wares.

foreignPrintings.name: Trato a la luz de la luna

cards.name: Mortipede
cards.text: {2}{G}: All creatures able to block Mortipede this turn do so.
cards.flavor: Mortipede pheromones choke the streets with sickly sweetness, luring the rash and unwary into its waiting jaws.

cards.name: Necromantic Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Necroplasm
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Necroplasm.
At the beginning of your end step, destroy each creature with mana value equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Necroplasm.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, you may mill two cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Netherborn Phalanx
cards.text:
When Netherborn Phalanx enters the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life for each creature they control.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Nightmare Void
cards.text:
Target player reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, you may mill two cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Ribbons of Night
cards.text: Ribbons of Night deals 4 damage to target creature and you gain 4 life. If {U} was spent to cast this spell, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"My favorite meal is angel's flesh, slain in agony and iced with black vinegar."
-Aszala of House Dimir

cards.name: Roofstalker Wight
cards.text: {1}{U}: Roofstalker Wight gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: No heartbeat to hear, no greed to bribe, no fear of death.

cards.name: Sadistic Augermage
cards.text: When Sadistic Augermage dies, each player puts a card from their hand on top of their library.
cards.flavor: "Don't worry. I know the drill."

foreignPrintings.name: サディストの穴開け魔道士

cards.name: Sewerdreg
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Sacrifice Sewerdreg: Exile target card from a graveyard.
cards.flavor: They hardly have form, dripping through pipe and grate with the slip and stench of flowing sewage.

cards.name: Shred Memory
cards.text:
Exile up to four target cards from a single graveyard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Sins of the Past
cards.text: Until end of turn, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that spell would be put into your graveyard this turn, exile it instead. Exile Sins of the Past.

cards.name: Stinkweed Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, you may mill five cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Strands of Undeath
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Strands of Undeath enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
{B}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Why limit yourself to mortal law when you can outlive those who enforce it?"
-Czaric, Orzhov prelate

cards.name: Thoughtpicker Witch
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at the top two cards of target opponent's library, then exile one of them.
cards.flavor: "Once the brew gets the brains nice and pickled, they're a lot easier to pick through."

cards.name: Undercity Shade
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{B}: Undercity Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Officially, there's nothing under that bridge to hunt . . . Unofficially, my torchers are too terrified to go there after nightfall."
-Agrus Kos

cards.name: Vigor Mortis
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast this spell, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

cards.name: Vindictive Mob
cards.text:
When Vindictive Mob enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
Vindictive Mob can't be blocked by Saprolings.
cards.flavor: Many minds, a single madness.

cards.name: Woebringer Demon
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature. If the player can't, sacrifice Woebringer Demon.
cards.flavor: Each soul he devours adds its hunger to his own.

cards.name: Barbarian Riftcutter
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Riftcutter: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"Riftcutters are suicidal anarchists, waving those lightning axes around so much that the walls are as likely to fall as their foes."
-Heruj, Selesnya initiate

cards.name: Blockbuster
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice Blockbuster: It deals 3 damage to each tapped creature and each player.
cards.flavor: Vendors hung cords heavy with roots and laid out boxes of salted meat, unaware of the fiery disaster swiftly approaching.

cards.name: Breath of Fury
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, sacrifice it and attach Breath of Fury to a creature you control. If you do, untap all creatures you control and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Char
cards.text: Char deals 4 damage to any target and 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Izzet mages often acquire their magic reagents from dubious sources, so the potency of their spells is never predictable.

cards.name: Cleansing Beam
cards.text: Radiance - Cleansing Beam deals 2 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor:
"Justice is toothless without punishment. Righteousness cannot succeed without the suffering of the guilty."
-Razia

cards.name: Coalhauler Swine
cards.text: Whenever Coalhauler Swine is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to each player.
cards.flavor: Nothing stops industry in Ravnica-certainly not the safety of its workers.

cards.name: Dogpile
cards.text: Dogpile deals damage to any target equal to the number of attacking creatures you control.
cards.flavor: There is no shelter from this storm, its rain of fists, or the thunderous cackles of bloodlust.

cards.name: Excruciator
cards.text: Damage that would be dealt by Excruciator can't be prevented.
cards.flavor:
"Though used as a piercing weapon, the tusk is more akin to a stinger, spreading pain instantly throughout the body of its victim. This specimen deserves further study."
-Simic research notes

cards.name: Fiery Conclusion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Fiery Conclusion deals 5 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Boros legionnaire saw a noble sacrifice, the Rakdos thug a blazing suicide, and the Izzet alchemist an experiment gone awry.

cards.name: Flame Fusillade
cards.text: Until end of turn, permanents you control gain "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to any target."
cards.flavor:
"A single item acting as lantern and lance? Now that's military efficiency."
-Brev Grezar, Boros lieutenant

cards.name: Flash Conscription
cards.text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. If {W} was spent to cast this spell, the creature gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain that much life" until end of turn.

cards.name: Frenzied Goblin
cards.text: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: The upside to not thinking about the consequences is that you'll always surprise those who do.

cards.name: Galvanic Arc
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Galvanic Arc enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to any target.
Enchanted creature has first strike.

cards.name: Goblin Fire Fiend
cards.text:
Haste
Goblin Fire Fiend must be blocked if able.
{R}: Goblin Fire Fiend gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Spelunkers
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: Chimney sweeps, explorers of abandoned buildings, spire climbers . . . goblin spelunkers have found countless niches within Ravnica's metropolis.

foreignPrintings.name: ゴブリンの洞窟探検家

cards.name: Greater Forgeling
cards.text: {1}{R}: Greater Forgeling gets +3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Few have seen the inner workings of Ravnica's furnaces, but neighboring districts catch brief glimpses in the horrors that escape the flames.

cards.name: Hammerfist Giant
cards.text: {T}: Hammerfist Giant deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Oh sure, they buy a lot of ale, but I always find myself needing to rebuild after the giants have paid a visit."
-Belko, owner of Titan's Keg tavern

cards.name: Hunted Dragon
cards.text:
Flying, haste
When Hunted Dragon enters the battlefield, target opponent creates three 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with first strike.
cards.flavor: The knights see a mighty quarry. The dragon sees breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

foreignPrintings.name: 狩り立てられたドラゴン

cards.name: Incite Hysteria
cards.text: Radiance - Until end of turn, target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain "This creature can't block."
cards.flavor:
"The Boros say they want to bring order to Ravnica. Funny then, how well they use chaos."
-Trigori, Azorius senator

cards.name: Indentured Oaf
cards.text: Prevent all damage that Indentured Oaf would deal to red creatures.
cards.flavor: All it knows is the difference between friend and food.

cards.name: Instill Furor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice this creature unless it attacked this turn."
cards.flavor:
"The Rakdos know little of technology, but they definitely know how to push buttons."
-Trivaz, Izzet mage

cards.name: Mindmoil
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, put the cards in your hand on the bottom of your library in any order, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor:
"My criticism of the Izzet is that their impulse for learning seems too much like impulse and too little like learning."
-Trigori, Azorius senator

cards.name: Molten Sentry
cards.text: As Molten Sentry enters the battlefield, flip a coin. If the coin comes up heads, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 5/2 creature with haste. If it comes up tails, Molten Sentry enters the battlefield as a 2/5 creature with defender.
cards.flavor: Some take after their father, Stone, some after their mother, Fire.

cards.name: Ordruun Commando
cards.text: {W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ordruun Commando this turn.
cards.flavor: Thick of muscle, stout of heart, and possessing a burning love of justice and the battlefield, the Ordruun minotaurs are the foundation of the Boros Legion.

cards.name: Rain of Embers
cards.text: Rain of Embers deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: There's plenty to talk about in the marketplaces of Ravnica, be it the latest feud between guilds or the terrible weather.

cards.name: Reroute
cards.text:
Change the target of target activated ability with a single target. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Three hundred years of practice thwarted by an instant of mischief.

cards.name: Sabertooth Alley Cat
cards.text:
Sabertooth Alley Cat attacks each combat if able.
{1}{R}: Creatures without defender can't block Sabertooth Alley Cat this turn.
cards.flavor: It has eight lives' worth of hunger to satisfy.

foreignPrintings.name: Chat de gouttière à dents de sabre

cards.name: Seismic Spike
cards.text: Destroy target land. Add {R}{R}.
cards.flavor: Natural disasters in Ravnica are largely nullified by the Izzet. Unnatural disasters, on the other hand, happen all of the time.

cards.name: Sell-Sword Brute
cards.text: When Sell-Sword Brute dies, it deals 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: "Killing is easy. Just wrap your hand around the haft, and wrap your enemy around the blade."

cards.name: Smash
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Ravnica's laws protect not its citizens but its industry. Aging equipment is destroyed rather than restored, to bring more money into the factories' coffers.

cards.name: Sparkmage Apprentice
cards.text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Pajik was amazed and pleased at his newfound powers. His pet cat Rivin was slightly less enthusiastic.

cards.name: Stoneshaker Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, that player sacrifices an untapped land.
cards.flavor: There is no place in Ravnica for stagnation, no room for lands unfilled and untilled.

foreignPrintings.name: 石揺すりのシャーマン

cards.name: Surge of Zeal
cards.text: Radiance - Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If only my poxes were as infectious as their zealotry."
-Savra

cards.name: Torpid Moloch
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice three lands: Torpid Moloch loses defender until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Market hucksters sell molochs for use as watchdogs. Of course, that's all molochs do. Sit around . . . and watch.

cards.name: Viashino Fangtail
cards.text: {T}: Viashino Fangtail deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"When the bony terminus gets too large, it's shed from the tail in coinciding periods of heightened aggression and hunger."
-Simic research notes

foreignPrintings.name: ヴィーアシーノの牙尾

cards.name: Viashino Slasher
cards.text: {R}: Viashino Slasher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Citizens of Ravnica stick to the main streets. Shortcuts may look tempting, but down each alley, dozens of hungry hands await, and screams do not carry into the busy market throng.

foreignPrintings.name: ヴィーアシーノの斬鬼

cards.name: Warp World
cards.text: Each player shuffles all permanents they own into their library, then reveals that many cards from the top of their library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of their library.

cards.name: War-Torch Goblin
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice War-Torch Goblin: It deals 2 damage to target blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"In a town shaped by the subtle machinations and political intrigue of its guilds, it's reassuring to see a goblin waving his torch and screaming about some nonsense or other."
-Agrus Kos

cards.name: Wojek Embermage
cards.text: Radiance - {T}: Wojek Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor: "Your brother's crimes are your crimes. You stood by and lent support, so you too must face judgment."

foreignPrintings.name: ウォジェクの燃えさし魔道士

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.

cards.name: Bramble Elemental
cards.text: Whenever an Aura becomes attached to Bramble Elemental, create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Ravnica is a seamless urban tapestry, each city bleeding into the next. In abandoned corners, however, nature has begun to reclaim what it once owned.

cards.name: Carven Caryatid
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Carven Caryatid enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: So-called "old wood" is rare in deforested Ravnica. Statues carved from it are said to house the last of the ancient nature spirits.

cards.name: Chord of Calling
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Search your library for a creature card with mana value X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

cards.name: Civic Wayfinder
cards.text: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: "These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square."

cards.name: Doubling Season
cards.text:
If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
If an effect would put one or more counters on a permanent you control, it puts twice that many of those counters on that permanent instead.

cards.name: Dowsing Shaman
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: He combs the streets looking for the lost light, the discarded enigmas of the city.

foreignPrintings.name: 占い棒使いのシャーマン

cards.name: Dryad's Caress
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each creature on the battlefield. If {W} was spent to cast this spell, untap all creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"I awoke to the face of beauty, my body fully healed. In that moment I knew my destiny was the Conclave's to shape."
-Rogad, Selesnya initiate

cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.text: {T}: Add {B}. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Cast out of the Conclave generations ago, these elves found a home in the corrupted districts of the Golgari.

cards.name: Elvish Skysweeper
cards.text: {4}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The spires of Ravnica are no different from the tall trees of other planes. The elves navigate and protect them just the same.

cards.name: Farseek
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
cards.flavor: "How truly vast this city must be, that I have traveled so far and seen so much, yet never once found the place where the buildings fail."

cards.name: Fists of Ironwood
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Fists of Ironwood enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
Enchanted creature has trample.
cards.flavor: Saprolings add the three and the four to the "one-two punch."

cards.name: Gather Courage
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Golgari Brownscale
cards.text:
When Golgari Brownscale is put into your hand from your graveyard, you gain 2 life.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, you may mill two cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Golgari Grave-Troll
cards.text:
Golgari Grave-Troll enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Golgari Grave-Troll: Regenerate Golgari Grave-Troll.
Dredge 6 (If you would draw a card, you may mill six cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

foreignPrintings.name: ゴルガリの墓トロール

cards.name: Goliath Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: The glittering strands of its complex web catch everything from a buzzing gnat to a passing bloatdrake.

cards.name: Greater Mossdog
cards.text: Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, you may mill three cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.flavor: Man's best fungus.

cards.name: Hunted Troll
cards.text:
When Hunted Troll enters the battlefield, target opponent creates four 1/1 blue Faerie creature tokens with flying.
{G}: Regenerate Hunted Troll.

foreignPrintings.name: 狩り立てられたトロール

cards.name: Ivy Dancer
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Her ivy locks are a remnant of the wooded wilds now lost to Ravnica forever.

cards.name: Life from the Loam
cards.text:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, you may mill three cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Moldervine Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, you may mill two cards instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Nullmage Shepherd
cards.text: Tap four untapped creatures you control: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The shepherds work in secret, seeking out abominations against nature and returning them to earth and dust.

cards.name: Overwhelm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let the song of Selesnya be heard above the rhythm of our thundering hordes!"

cards.name: Perilous Forays
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a land card with a basic land type, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
cards.flavor:
"This is the place? This map has got to be wrong . . . ."
-Svania Trul, wayfinder novice, last words

cards.name: Primordial Sage
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: For each creature that arrives in its audience, the sage imparts another piece of ancient wisdom for all to hear.

cards.name: Recollect
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales-if you know how to speak their language."
-Savra

cards.name: Rolling Spoil
cards.text: Destroy target land. If {B} was spent to cast this spell, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The shadow that fell over the grove was silent yet horribly alive, roiling with millions of tiny minions dedicated to the process of rot.

cards.name: Root-Kin Ally
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Tap two untapped creatures you control: Root-Kin Ally gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Scatter the Seeds
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
cards.flavor: From the seeds of faith, great forests grow.

cards.name: Scion of the Wild
cards.text: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.

cards.name: Siege Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample
cards.flavor: The Rubblefield was once among the wealthiest districts in Ravnica. All it took was a single wurm to reduce it to ruins.

cards.name: Stone-Seeder Hierophant
cards.text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, untap Stone-Seeder Hierophant.
{T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: Her touch brings to bare stone what water and sun bring to rich soil.

cards.name: Sundering Vitae
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Centuries of wind, rain, and roots compressed into an instant of destruction: such is the power of Selesnya.

cards.name: Transluminant
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice Transluminant: Create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "Forget yourself. Forget your city. Forget your homes, your families, the debts and obligations that hold you to this world."

cards.name: Trophy Hunter
cards.text:
{1}{G}: Trophy Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
Whenever a creature with flying dealt damage by Trophy Hunter this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Trophy Hunter.

cards.name: Ursapine
cards.text: {G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A friendly ursapine means a constant supply of sharp spears. An unfriendly one means a constant supply of small holes.

cards.name: Vinelasher Kudzu
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Vinelasher Kudzu.
cards.flavor: It grows to hate you.

cards.name: Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran
cards.text: Whenever Agrus Kos, Wojek Veteran attacks, attacking red creatures get +2/+0 and attacking white creatures get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Lieutenant Kos has never met a group of recruits he could not inspire or a mob he could not quell.

foreignPrintings.name: ウォジェクの古参兵、アグルス・コス

cards.name: Autochthon Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample
cards.flavor: The trainer awoke to begin the journey from the wurm's tail to its head. The sun was setting when she arrived.

cards.name: Bloodbond March
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, each player returns all cards with the same name as that spell from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The Golgari support a vast army because death never ends its soldiers' service.

cards.name: Boros Swiftblade
cards.text: Double strike
cards.flavor: When the Boros Legion attacks, swiftblades enter the fray first. They pick off the archers and mages, softening the enemy front before the flame-kin and giants go in.

cards.name: Brightflame
cards.text: Radiance - Brightflame deals X damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor:
"Let the pyres of the unbelievers light our way."
-Razia

cards.name: Chorus of the Conclave
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
As an additional cost to cast creature spells, you may pay any amount of mana. If you do, that creature enters the battlefield with that many additional +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: "We are many, yet one. We are separate in body, yet speak with a single voice. Join us in our chorus."

cards.name: Circu, Dimir Lobotomist
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a blue spell, exile the top card of target player's library.
Whenever you cast a black spell, exile the top card of target player's library.
Your opponents can't cast spells with the same name as a card exiled with Circu, Dimir Lobotomist.

foreignPrintings.name: ディミーアの脳外科医、シアクー

cards.name: Clutch of the Undercity
cards.text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Its controller loses 3 life.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Congregation at Dawn
cards.text: Search your library for up to three creature cards, reveal them, then shuffle and put those cards on top in any order.
cards.flavor: "It is fitting that we meet in the first hour of light, for we are called by the Conclave to pierce a threat of darkness."

cards.name: Consult the Necrosages
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Target player draws two cards.
• Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: Dimir rank and file never see nor hear their guildmaster. All orders are given through mysterious necrosages who appear from the shadows, tersely toss out a command, and then melt into the darkness.

cards.name: Dark Heart of the Wood
cards.text: Sacrifice a Forest: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"The soil here is rich with the rotting dead, and the sun's fingers barely penetrate the dark canopy. Plant our brethren here. This shall be our sanctuary."
-Savra

cards.name: Dimir Cutpurse
cards.text: Whenever Dimir Cutpurse deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card and you draw a card.
cards.flavor: Other guilds demand tolls from those who travel their territories, but not House Dimir. It takes its share secretly, one coin purse at a time.

foreignPrintings.name: ディミーアの巾着切り

cards.name: Dimir Doppelganger
cards.text: {1}{U}{B}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Dimir Doppelganger becomes a copy of that card, except it has this ability.
cards.flavor: "Fear not. Your life will not go unlived."

foreignPrintings.name: ディミーアのドッペルゲンガー

cards.name: Dimir Infiltrator
cards.text:
Dimir Infiltrator can't be blocked.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Drooling Groodion
cards.text: {2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Golgari expand, yes, but I refuse to call their tainted creations 'growth.'"
-Veszka, Selesnya evangel

foreignPrintings.name: よだれ垂らしのグルーディオン

cards.name: Firemane Angel
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Firemane Angel is in your graveyard or on the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
{6}{R}{R}{W}{W}: Return Firemane Angel from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Flame-Kin Zealot
cards.text: When Flame-Kin Zealot enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Boros soldiers are like a cache of bombs ready to explode, and the flame-kin light their fuses.

cards.name: Glare of Subdual
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact or creature.
cards.flavor: The righteous light of Selesnya is channeled through the devout, striking out to blind the nonbelievers.

cards.name: Glimpse the Unthinkable
cards.text: Target player mills ten cards.
cards.flavor:
"I am confident that if anyone actually penetrates our facades, even the most perceptive would still be fundamentally unprepared for the truth of House Dimir."
-Szadek

cards.name: Golgari Germination
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: The Golgari don't bury their dead. They plant them.

cards.name: Golgari Rotwurm
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Like corpse-worms through a carapace, rotwurms slide through the hollowed bones of the undercity.

foreignPrintings.name: ゴルガリの腐れワーム

cards.name: Grave-Shell Scarab
cards.text:
{1}, Sacrifice Grave-Shell Scarab: Draw a card.
Dredge 1 (If you would draw a card, you may mill a card instead. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Guardian of Vitu-Ghazi
cards.text:

cards.name: Lightning Helix

cards.flavor: Though less well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boros Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.

{G}{W}, Sacrifice Loxodon Hierarch: Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.flavor: "I have lived long, and I remember how this city once was. If my death serves to bring back the Ravnica in my memory, then so be it."

"Touched by moroii"

cards.text:

cards.name: Phytohydra
cards.text: If damage would be dealt to Phytohydra, put that many +1/+1 counters on it instead.
cards.flavor:
"Look at this creature, so like the Conclave it serves. Cut one head and it grows two. Damage it and it flourishes."

"Gold can be reearned, goods restored. The moroii steal youth, more precious than either, and once gone, it's gone forever."

cards.name: Putrefy

Flying, vigilance, haste
